page.title: 08Interview with a Paratrooper
page.content: On May 16th 1985 we went to Picton Barracks to interview a paratrooper named Private Jones.He has been in the 1st Battalion Parachute Regiment for three and a half years. He expects his posting at Bulford to last four years, but he spends four to five months away on exercise every year. When the Regiment is in camp the working day is from 8am until 5pm,but on exercise the men are on permanent alert. Time in camp is spent repainting and refurbishing equipment and doing drill. Private Jones joined the Army because he found civilian life boring. His original training was very hard and lasted for six months.He now makes four or five drops a year from balloons,helicopters and aeroplanes. He must be very fit, so he runs for an hour a day to maintain fitness.
